results.title: Simple demonstrations with water
results.brief_description: Demonstrations to illustrate that water has surface tension which acts like a film over it, that water exerts pressure, and that water can produce a buoyant force.

results.title: Simple demonstrations with static electricity
results.brief_description: Demonstrates basic concepts of static electricity. Shows that friction can produce static electricity, that both positive and negative charges can be created, that identical charges repel and opposite charges attract, and that all matter is electrically charged.
results.description: Demonstrates basic concepts of static electricity. Shows that friction can produce static electricity, that both positive and negative charges can be created, that identical charges repel and opposite charges attract, and that all matter is electrically charged.

results.title: Simple demonstrations with magnetism
results.brief_description: Interesting demonstrations and experiments explain and illustrate the basic concepts of magnetism: magnets can produce a force, magnets have poles, magnets can make other magnets, and the earth is a magnet. Many of the experiments can be repeated in the classroom, while others use equipment not available in most schools.

results.title: Simple demonstrations with air
results.brief_description: Presentation of factual information about air. Demonstrates that air has weight, exerts pressure, and is compressible. Simple equipment, with the exception of the mercury barometer and the vacuum pump is used to demonstrate these facts.
results.description: Presentation of factual information about air. Demonstrates that air has weight, exerts pressure, and is compressible. Simple equipment, with the exception of the mercury barometer and the vacuum pump is used to demonstrate these facts.

results.title: Simple ceramics (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A fascinating demonstration of elementary ceramic work. Culminates in an ingenious use of domestic kitchen utensils to create an elaborate and attractive fruit bowl.

results.title: Silversmith
results.brief_description: The work of the silversmith is essentially that of a craftsman unassisted by modern methods of mass production. The beauty and delicacy of his hand-made creations in silver and leather make him one of the most versatile of craftsmen. This film shows the many processes involved in the creation of fine silverware, together with the tools which have been used for centuries without change.

results.title: Silver's new shine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Today silver plays a new role in Britain. Since 1947 it has ceased to be used in British coinage and is put to work more and more widely in a variety of industries. Old silver coins are refined at the Royal Mint, to supply industry with more of this precious mineral, also used in the fine silver work for which Britain’s silversmith’s are traditionally famous.

group_siblings.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold

results.title: Silver
results.creator_credit: Wim Vandekeybus, Quasi Modo and Ultima Vez
results.brief_description: Ultima Vez is a dance company formed by director, choreographer, actor and photographer Wim Vandekeybus in 1985. Drawing his dance vocabulary from everyday movements, his style is high adrenaline with genuine sense of jeopardy. Vandekeybus used an Irish nursery rhyme as a basis for his performance ‘7 for a Secret never to be told’ (1997). The performance was made up of seven interflowing sections, alluding to ‘two extreme emotions, the two sexes, two precious metals and a secret’. For each scene a specific scenography and different movement material was developed. This dance video is an adaptation of the fifth scene of the performance. Music, Thierry De Mey.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wim Vandekeybus, Quasi Modo and Ultima Vez

results.title: Silver
results.brief_description: Footage of various facets of the silver smithing process - the production of sterling silver cutlery, engraving of silver platters, how silver is used to produce mirrors, and the importance of silver to the photographic process. Silent short produced for classroon instructional purposes.
